definition: to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
to receive/to answer (the phone)/to meet or welcome sb/to connect/to catch/to join/to extend/to take one's turn on duty/to take over for sb

sentences.english: The reciever ran wide to catch the pass.
sentences.chinese: 接球员跑动范围很宽，以便接到传球。

sentences.english: The game started at a quick pace with a lot of interchanging of passes.
sentences.chinese: 比赛一开始速度就非常快，传接球配合频繁。

sentences.english: Most of the time it's about receiving and passing, attention to detail.
sentences.chinese: 大部分时间都是简单的传接球，要注意细节。

sentences.english: You can catch the ball well.
Why didn't the baseball catcher meet Dinderella?
sentences.chinese: 棒球队的接球员为什么没有见到灰姑娘？

sentences.english: The basic techniques concerned with passing, taking a pass and dribbling are the weakness in the real games.
sentences.chinese: 传接球和运球基本技术在实战运用中是薄弱环节。

sentences.english: He is one of the best passers and receivers of a ball in the world.
sentences.chinese: 他是世界上传接球方面最好的球员之一。

sentences.english: In soccer, only goalkeepers may use their hands to play the ball.
sentences.chinese: 在足球比赛中，只有守门员才可用手接球。

sentences.english: He fumbled the catch and dropped the ball.
The baseball player is catching the ball.
And there are the set of devices. Thank you.
sentences.chinese: 很漂亮的接球，好，现在你们已经明白。

sentences.english: Players must get into the rhythm of the game and passes.
sentences.chinese: 球员在练习中必须流畅，传接球有节奏感。

sentences.english: Charlie was nine when he was able to catch a ball.
sentences.chinese: 当他能接球的时候查理已经9岁了。

sentences.english: Momo caught at the ball but missed it.
sentences.chinese: 默默想去接球但没有接住。

sentences.english: You should catch the ball with both hands.

definition: to set up a teammate (with an opportunity to score)/to throw a game
(military) line of troops encircling an enemy position/(telephony) outside line/(basketball) outside the three-point line
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
